text: Herpha, also known as Erpha and Herpa and Erpa, was a town of ancient Cappadocia, inhabited during Hellenistic, Roman, and Byzantine times. Its site is located at the crossing of the Karmalas on the main road, Asiatic Turkey. ==References== Category:Populated places in ancient Cappadocia Category:Former populated places in Turkey Category:Populated places of the Byzantine Empire Category:Roman towns and cities in Turkey Category:History of Kayseri Province
